statements: SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE category='Groceries';
SELECT expense_name, amount FROM expenses WHERE amount > 100;
SELECT id, expense_name, category FROM expenses ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE amount BETWEEN 50 AND 200;
SELECT id, expense_name, date FROM expenses WHERE category='Utilities' ORDER BY date ASC;
SELECT id, expense_name, amount, category, date FROM expenses WHERE category = 'Groceries';
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE amount > 100 ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT expense_name, category, amount FROM expenses WHERE date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31' ORDER BY amount ASC;
SELECT id, expense_name, category, amount FROM expenses WHERE id IN (1, 3, 5) OR category = 'Utilities' ORDER BY category, amount DESC;
SELECT AVG(amount) AS average_expense, category FROM expenses GROUP BY category HAVING AVG(amount) > 50 ORDER BY average_expense DESC, category;
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE category = 'Food'
SELECT description, amount FROM expenses WHERE amount > 50
SELECT id, category, amount FROM expenses ORDER BY amount DESC
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE amount BETWEEN 100 AND 200
SELECT category, COUNT(*) FROM expenses GROUP BY category
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE category='Food' ORDER BY amount DESC;
SELECT id, description FROM expenses WHERE amount > 100 ORDER BY id;
SELECT category, SUM(amount) AS total_amount FROM expenses GROUP BY category ORDER BY total_amount DESC;
SELECT e.category, e.amount, c.name FROM expenses e LEFT JOIN categories c ON e.category = c.name ORDER BY e.amount;
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE description LIKE '%important%' ORDER BY id ASC;
SELECT * FROM expenses_tracking WHERE amount > 100 ORDER BY date DESC
SELECT id, category FROM expenses_tracking WHERE category = 'Groceries'
SELECT user_name, email FROM expense_users ORDER BY user_name ASC
SELECT id, amount, category FROM expenses_tracking WHERE category LIKE '%Utility%'
SELECT id, category FROM expenses_tracking WHERE amount > 500
SELECT * FROM expenses_tracking WHERE amount > 100 ORDER BY date DESC
SELECT id, category FROM expenses_tracking WHERE category='Groceries'
SELECT id, user_name FROM expense_users ORDER BY user_name ASC

SELECT category_name, COUNT(id) AS total_expenses FROM expense_categories INNER JOIN expenses_tracking ON expense_categories.id = expenses_tracking.id GROUP BY category_name ORDER BY total_expenses DESC
SELECT DISTINCT category_name FROM expense_categories
SELECT * FROM expenses
SELECT expense_id, category, amount FROM expenses WHERE amount > 100
SELECT category, SUM(amount) AS total_expenses FROM expenses GROUP BY category
SELECT e.category, c.category_name, e.amount FROM expenses e JOIN categories c ON e.category = c.category_name
SELECT u.username, e.amount, el.date FROM users u JOIN expense_logs el ON u.user_id = el.user_id JOIN expenses e ON el.expense_id = e.expense_id
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE amount > 1000 ORDER BY expense_id DESC;
SELECT category, SUM(amount) AS total_amount FROM expenses GROUP BY category ORDER BY total_amount DESC;
SELECT u.username, e.amount FROM users u JOIN expenses e ON e.category = 'Groceries' AND e.user_id = u.user_id;
SELECT e.expense_id, e.amount, c.category_name FROM expenses e JOIN categories c ON e.category = c.category_name WHERE e.amount < 500 ORDER BY e.expense_id;
SELECT u.username, e.amount, el.date FROM users u JOIN expense_logs el ON u.user_id = el.user_id JOIN expenses e ON e.expense_id = el.expense_id WHERE el.date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM expenses;
SELECT expense_name, amount FROM expenses WHERE amount > 100;
SELECT category, SUM(amount) AS total_amount FROM expenses GROUP BY category;
SELECT id, username FROM users WHERE id = 1;
SELECT expense_name, category_name FROM expenses JOIN expense_categories ON expenses.id = expense_categories.expense_id JOIN categories ON categories.id = expense_categories.category_id;
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE amount > 1000 ORDER BY expense_name DESC, id ASC
SELECT expense_name, category FROM expenses INNER JOIN expense_categories ON expenses.id = expense_categories.expense_id WHERE expense_categories.category_id = 2

SELECT users.username, expenses.expense_name, categories.category_name FROM users INNER JOIN user_expenses ON users.id = user_expenses.user_id INNER JOIN expenses ON user_expenses.expense_id = expenses.id INNER JOIN expense_categories ON expenses.id = expense_categories.expense_id INNER JOIN categories ON expense_categories.category_id = categories.id WHERE user_id = 1
SELECT * FROM expenses WHERE category = 'Food' AND amount BETWEEN 50 AND 100 ORDER BY amount DESC
SELECT expense_name, SUM(amount) AS total_amount FROM expenses GROUP BY expense_name HAVING total_amount > 20000
